abstract: Rhode Island Episcopal Diocese announces plans, against national backdrop of racial tension, for museum in its Providence cathedral devoted to understanding church’s complicity in trans-Atlantic slave trade; continuing ongoing process of racial reconciliation and designed together with descendants of area slaveholders, museum, first of its kind in the North, will highlight extensive but obscure history of New England slavery.
lead_paragraph: The Episcopal Diocese of Rhode Island is establishing a slavery museum and reconciliation center in an old cathedral as part of an effort to acknowledge its own complicity in the slave trade.

headline.main: Rhode Island Church Taking Unusual Step to Illuminate Its Slavery Role
